content.question: An object having an initial momentum that may be represented by the vector above strikes an object that is initially at rest. Which of the following sets of vectors may represent the momenta of the two objects after the collision?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two arrows. In choice A, the two arrows start in the center pointing out with the same length, one to the left and one to the right.
Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two arrows.  In choice B, the two arrows lie on a horizontal line with both pointing to the right. The second arrow starts where the first arrow ends.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two arrows.  In choice C, the two arrows start in the center with one pointing out to the left and one out to the right, and the arrow on the left is longer than the arrow on the right.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two arrows.  In choice D, the arrows point out from a center point with one pointing up and to the right and one down and to the left, but not along a straight line. The arrows are the same length.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two arrows.  In choice E, the arrows point out from a center point with one pointing up and to the right and one down and to the right, with the one pointing up being shorter than the one pointing down.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two arrows.  In choice E, the arrows point out from a center point with one pointing up and to the right and one down and to the right, with the one pointing up being shorter than the one pointing down.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
